data.title: Mirror the Words
data.statement:
You are given a sentence and a list of rules.
Each rule tells you whether a word must be reversed {{R}} or kept as-is {{K}}.

Your task is to rebuild the sentence by applying the rules word by word, while keeping the original word order.

Simple in appearance. Dangerous in the details.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a sentence and a list of rules.
Each rule tells you whether a word must be reversed R or kept as-is K.

Your task is to rebuild the sentence by applying the rules word by word, while keeping the original word order.

Simple in appearance. Dangerous in the details.
Input
Line 1: An integer N, the number of words in the sentence.
Line 2: A string S containing exactly N words separated by single spaces.
Line 3: A string R of length N consisting only of the constants R or K.
Output
Line 1: The transformed sentence after applying all rules.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10
1 ≤ length of each word in S ≤ 10
Every word in S contains lowercase English letters only
The string R is exactly length N with only R and K
Example
Input
3
hello world java
RKR
Output
olleh world avaj
